title: [BEAM-8493] Add test to standard double coder
body:
This PR adds a test to the standard double coder. The test cases are modeled from that used in the [sdks/python/apache_beam/coders/coders_test_common.py#L189](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/master/sdks/python/apache_beam/coders/coders_test_common.py#L189). I would like to request either @youngoli or @lostluck to review this PR. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] ~~Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes.~~ - [ ] ~~If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf).~~ See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11588] Fix the dependency
body:
1. Newer ipykernel now depends on jupyter-client and their transitive dependencies on jedi have conflicts, thus explicitly selecting a jupyter-client version without the conflict. 2. Removed jupyter-client version limit from INTERACTIVE_BEAM_TEST deps because INTERACTIVE_BEAM now transitively installs jupyter-client. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-11586] Fix on-demand pulling of Java container licenses
body:
Fixes https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-11586 by removing artifact for Java licenses. Verified manually by running `./gradlew :sdks:java:container:java8:docker --info` with `-Pdocker-pull-licenses` toggled on/off and inspecting the container built ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: Update the blog date for 2.27
body:
**Please** add a meaningful description for your change here ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11531] Fix ParseToDataframeTest pandas 1.2.0 breakage
body:
Unfortunately this usage of `pd.testing.assert_frame_equal` seems to be broken in pandas 1.2.0. It's possible it's a bug we should report upstream. title: Remove redundant or inappropriate pieces of the capability matrix
body:
Each commit is an independent change that removes something that should not be in the capability matrix: - runners that are on branches and not released - features that are not designed and may even require inventing new things, or may be impossible - redundant columns ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11580] Add disk_size_gb flag for Go SDK.
body:

title: [BEAM-11461] update tox and simplify tox.ini

update tox version to the latest to use generative section name for simpler tox.ini ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: Add version and sdk_version as inputs to ProcessResources task.

title: [BEAM-10961] Enabled strict dependency on SDKS-Testing
body:
Since enabling the strict dependencies on all Java modules is a large and critical change to be merged all at once. Therefore, task [[BEAM-10961](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-10961)] is divided into sub-tasks and strict dependencies are enabled to each module separately which is comparatively easy to review and merge. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10961] enabled strict dependency on sdks-core and sdks-expansion-service
body:
Since enabling the strict dependencies on all Java modules is a large and critical change to be merged all at once. Therefore, task [[BEAM-10961](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-10961)] is divided into sub-tasks and strict dependencies are enabled to each module separately which is comparatively easy to review and merge. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-11415] Enabling new ValidatesRunner framework on Jenkins.
body:
Should run the same tests that the existing driver runs. Also includes some updates to the script to handle Jenkins' environment compared to being run locally. That can be enabled with the --jenkins flag. Finally, adjusts the way the script and tests handle missing expansion service jars and addresses, so that the XLang tests will just be skipped and the expansion service not launched if the required flags aren't included in the command. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11531] Allow pandas <1.3.0
body:
All of the blocking changes have been merged. This PR removes restriction on pandas to allow upgrade to 1.2.0 and 1.2.1. Unfortunately there was a new breakage in pandas 1.2.1 caused by https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/issues/39474. So this PR includes a couple of other changes: - Skips affected test when run with 1.2.1 - Removes special handling for pandas 0.x, we already opted not to support it. title: [BEAM-11569] Fixing cancel workflows
body:
**Please** add a meaningful description for your change here ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9541] Jenkins tests use latest Flink version (1.12).
body:

title: [BEAM-11572] Replace Assert.asserThat with MatcherAssert.assertThat across entire codebase
body:
JUnit [`Assert#assertThat`](https://junit.org/junit4/javadoc/latest/org/junit/Assert.html#assertThat(T,%20org.hamcrest.Matcher)) is deprecated and needs to be replaced across entire codebase with [`MatcherAssert#assertThat`](https://junit.org/junit4/javadoc/latest/org/junit/Assert.html#assertThat(T,%20org.hamcrest.Matcher)) as per recommendation.

@iemejia  Thanks for reviewing my previous PRs. This is a massive PR, but few line changes in each file. how should I proceed?

title: [BEAM-10961] Enabled strict dependency on Twister2
body:
Since enabling the strict dependencies on all Java modules is a large and critical change to be merged all at once. Therefore, task [[BEAM-10961](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-10961)] is divided into sub-tasks and strict dependencies are enabled to each module separately which is comparatively easy to review and merge. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10961] Enabled strict dependencies on samza
body:
Since enabling the strict dependencies on all Java modules is a large and critical change to be merged all at once. Therefore, task [[BEAM-10961](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-10961)] is divided into sub-tasks and strict dependencies are enabled to each module separately which is comparatively easy to review and merge. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10961] Enabled strict dependency on Local Java
body:
Since enabling the strict dependencies on all Java modules is a large and critical change to be merged all at once. Therefore, task [[BEAM-10961](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-10961)] is divided into sub-tasks and strict dependencies are enabled to each module separately which is comparatively easy to review and merge. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Move junit out of runtime dependencies
body:
This is using an old version of Junit (4.13-beta-3), which is being included in the compile configuration rather than testCompile. It is being flagged in our project for vulnerability: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-15250. title: [BEAM-10961] Enabled strict dependencies on java-job-service
body:
Since enabling the strict dependencies on all Java modules is a large and critical change to be merged all at once. Therefore, task [[BEAM-10961](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-10961)] is divided into sub-tasks and strict dependencies are enabled to each module separately which is comparatively easy to review and merge. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-10961] Enable strict dependency on Google Cloud Dataflow runner
body:
Since enabling the strict dependencies on all Java modules is a large and critical change to be merged all at once. Therefore, task [[BEAM-10961](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-10961)] is divided into sub-tasks and strict dependencies are enabled to each module separately which is comparatively easy to review and merge. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10961] Enabled strict dependency on flink runner
body:
Since enabling the strict dependencies on all Java modules is a large and critical change to be merged all at once. Therefore, task [[BEAM-10961](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-10961)] is divided into sub-tasks and strict dependencies are enabled to each module separately which is comparatively easy to review and merge. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10961] Enabled strict dependency on Direct Java runner
body:
Since enabling the strict dependencies on all Java modules is a large and critical change to be merged all at once. Therefore, task [[BEAM-10961](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-10961)] is divided into sub-tasks and strict dependencies are enabled to each module separately which is comparatively easy to review and merge. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10961] Enabled strict dependency on Core Java runner
body:
Since enabling the strict dependencies on all Java modules is a large and critical change to be merged all at once. Therefore, task [[BEAM-10961](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-10961)] is divided into sub-tasks and strict dependencies are enabled to each module separately which is comparatively easy to review and merge. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11512] Fix sdk.properties caching, remove timestamp
body:
This PR does two things. 1. It removes the timestamp from the sdk.properties file. 2. This doesn't ignore the `sdk.properties` anymore for the purposes of the runtime classpath. This means that the tests will rerun when the versions change. This PR assumes that [there is no need for the timestamp in the sdk.properties](https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/13597#issuecomment-750423282). If there is such a need, the other option to resolve this issue is to wait until Gradle 6.8 is released which will have the ability to ignore specific properties [such as the timestamp](https://docs.gradle.org/6.8-rc-3/release-notes.html#more-cache-hits-for-tasks-with-runtime-classpaths) in the sdk.properties file. See the discussion on [the PR](https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/13597) for more information. This PR replaces https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/13597 and https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/13600 and solves BEAM-11512 ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10961] Enabled strict dependencies on model module
body:
Since enabling the strict dependencies on all Java modules is a large and critical change to be merged all at once. Therefore, task [[BEAM-10961](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-10961)] is divided into sub-tasks and strict dependencies are enabled to each module separately which is comparatively easy to review and merge. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-10961] Enabled strict dependency on core-construction runner module
body:
Since enabling the strict dependencies on all Java modules is a large and critical change to be merged all at once. Therefore, task [[BEAM-10961](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-10961)] is divided into sub-tasks and strict dependencies are enabled to each module separately which is comparatively easy to review and merge. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11526] Cleanup Code for Schema support

title: [BEAM-11434]Make SpannerAccessor public
body:
Spanner Accessor was made to package private in an earlier pull request from public. https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/10765 Spanner import/export templates were using some of the public methods from this class. As a result it was required to copy these classes into Spanner templates causing issues. This patch makes this class public. title: [BEAM-11543] Increase Spanner streaming read timeout to 2 hours
body:
Prior to BEAM2.20 with Cloud Spanner Library 1.06, the timeout for Cloud Spanner streaming read was 2 hours. This was changed to 1 hour with the library update in BEAM 2.20. Setting this value back to 2 hours. R: @nielm @chamikaramj ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-11526] Add Beam schema support for ParquetIO reads.
body:
Support using Beam schema with ParquetIO. The functionality is put behind a user configurable flag (`inferSchema`) to maintain backward compatibility. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) @iemejia. - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. title: [BEAM-11411] [BEAM-11410] Kafka to pub sub E2E test
body:
E2E test for [Kafka to Pub/Sub](https://github.com/apache/beam/tree/master/examples/java/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/examples/complete/kafkatopubsub) pipeline example. This test initializes Apache Kafka and Google Cloud Pub/Sub Emulator using Testcontainers [Kafka](https://www.testcontainers.org/modules/kafka/) and [GCloud](https://www.testcontainers.org/modules/gcloud/) modules respectively. After that we publish a message to Kafka topic and wait for it to appear in Pub/Sub topic. If message is not received in 2 minutes test fails. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11538] Add a Deque Encoder
body:
**Please** add a meaningful description for your change here. A Deque is in certain situations faster than a List: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/6163166/why-is-arraydeque-better-than-linkedlist. When writing a custom CombineFn, appending is something that we often do, therefore I think it is a nice addition to the default encoders. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). R: @iemejia - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [DO NOT MERGE] Run seed job on open PRs.
body:
**Please** add a meaningful description for your change here ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11530] Annotated setter parameters handled wrong in schema creation
body:
I'm facing an exception telling me that my JavaBean contained a setter for a field that had a mismatching nullable attribute, although both getter and setter (parameters) are annotated with `@Nullable` (`org.apache.avro.reflect.Nullable`). ```java @DefaultSchema(JavaBeanSchema.class) public final class SampleBean { @Nullable private Float value; public @Nullable Float getValue() { return value; } public void setValue(@Nullable Float value) { this.value = value; } } ``` The code responsible for determining if a setter's parameter is nullable looks wrong to me, since it ~~does check if the type (class) itself is annotated with `@Nullable` instead of checking the actual parameter's annotations.~~ only considers type annotations instead of looking at parameter annotations, too. Java distinguishes between parameter annotations and type annotations. Therefore annotations declared without `java.lang.annotation.ElementType#TYPE_USE` can't be accessed through `Executable#getAnnotatedParameterTypes()`. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Fix for Kafka To PubSub Example
body:
In case if `trustoreLocation` and/or `keystoreLocation` parameters aren't specified the pipeline would fail. This PR fixes this issue and enables the scenario where the user does not want to provide key/trust stores, and only wants unencrypted communication. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-11527] Allow user defined Hadoop ReadSupport flags for ParquetReader
body:
`ParquetIO.Sink` supports user provided Configuration flags. With increasing number of flags in AvroParquetReader options. Making the configuration flags accessible to the user makes it more usable. For example, enable reading INT96 data. R:@iemejia can you help review. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. title: [BEAM-11289] [Python] Integrate Google Cloud Recommendations AI functionality
body:
Integrate Google Cloud Recommendations AI functionality ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-11460] Support reading Parquet files with unknown schema
body:
Data engineers encounter times when schema of Parquet file is unknown at the time of writing the pipeline or multiple schema may be present in different files. Reading Parquet files using ParquetIO requires providing an Avro (equivalent) schema, Many a times its not possible to know the schema of the Parquet files. On the other hand [AvroIO](https://beam.apache.org/releases/javadoc/2.26.0/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/AvroIO.html) supports reading unknow schema files by providing a parse function : `#parseGenericRecords(SerializableFunction)` Supporting this functionality in ParquetIO is simple and requires minimal changes to the ParquetIO surface. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] Added new tests for the feature in `ParquetIOTest` - [x] Reviewers - @iemejia @aromanenko-dev - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). created instead of [PR/13554](https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/13554) due to change in source branch.
